info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 17 at 1:32PM MDT until July 17 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Hot temperatures of 95 to 101 degrees following poor overnight cooling this morning with low temperatures only reaching 65 to 75 degrees for many areas. * WHERE...The eastern Magic Valley, lower Snake Plain, Raft River region, and southern highlands, including but not limited to Burley, Heyburn, American Falls, Aberdeen, Blackfoot, Fort Hall, Chubbuck, Pocatello, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, and Preston. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures this afternoon following poor overnight cooling this morning may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or late evening. Drink plenty of fluids. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
